title: City-wide Covid testing to be trialled in Liverpool
description: It will use rapid results tests that could be offered to "millions" by Christmas, the PM says.

title: Melbourne Cup 2020: Twilight Payment wins Flemington race for Irish trainer Joseph O'Brien
description: Twilight Payment wins the Melbourne Cup to give Irish trainer Joseph O'Brien a second victory in the 'race that stops a nation'.

title: Vienna shooting: Gunman hunted after deadly 'terror' attack
description: Two people are dead, along with a gunman, after attacks at six different locations, police say.

title: US Election 2020: Biden and Trump make final pitches to voters
description: A day before the US election, the rival candidates make last-ditch efforts to persuade voters in key states.

title: Lockdown retail: 'It has been the toughest year I've ever had'
description: 'Non-essential' retailers have to shut for a month from Thursday and they are scrambling to adapt.

title: Universities and colleges face Covid funding shortfalls
description: Worries about overseas students, Covid and pensions are damaging university finances, says report.

title: BBC Four's unexpected monologues on disability
description: New series presents a variety of thought-provoking stories written and performed by disabled people.

title: Basildon maternity unit handed 'urgent' safety deadline
description: NHS inspectors find a hospital trust has not dealt with serious failings it had been warned about.

title: 'A mask over my mouth feels like my attacker's hand'
description: Georgina Fallows is asking government to protect from harassment people who can't wear face coverings.

title: Who kept his mum and dad happy - and made Garth Crooks' team of the week?
description: Who kept his parents happy? Who is in fantastic form? Will history repeat itself? Garth Crooks names his team of the week.

title: Newspaper headlines: 'Virus battle won by spring' as mass tests piloted
description: Tuesday's papers lead with the PM's comments in the Commons after he announced England's lockdown.

title: US election 2020: Trump and Biden pictured through the years
description: The political and personal lives of the candidates over seven decades.

title: #EndSars protests: How Anthony Unuode gave his life for a better Nigeria
description: Nigerians pay tribute to #EndSars protester Anthony Unuode after he was killed in the capital.

title: Three elders give advice for Trump and Biden
description: From deep in the Maasai lands of Kenya to high in the mountains of Tibet, we found this advice for Donald Trump and Joe Biden.

title: Coronavirus: Behind the scenes of developing a Covid-19 vaccine
description: Meet the scientists who use social media to show people what they do to develop a coronavirus vaccine in the lab.

title: The Welsh community pulling together to feed families
description: Panteg House social club in Pontypool became a distribution centre and food bank during lockdown.

title: Stonehaven derailment: Line reopens after three months
description: The line between Aberdeen and Dundee closed after the crash in August which left three people dead.

title: Be a 'secret agent' and other new ways to exercise
description: Turning a run into an adventure is just one of the innovations in the exercise industry.

title: Third of staff 'fear catching Covid at work'
description: The poorest paid are particularly worried - but are also the least likely to speak up, research finds.

title: Vardy produces another 'masterclass' - but can Leicester fight for the title?
description: BBC Sport looks at why Leicester could be considered title challengers this season after another 'masterclass' performance from Jamie Vardy.

title: Bushfire koalas going back to the wild
description: Thousands of creatures were killed and injured in last summer's blazes on South Australia's Kangaroo Island.

title: 'I thought maybe I would die': S Korea's delivery drivers demand change
description: Families in South Korea are reeling after the deaths of 14 delivery workers this year from what they call overwork.

title: Coronavirus lockdown: Children's grassroots sport to be halted - culture secretary
description: Children's grassroots sport played outside of school will be suspended during England's four-week lockdown, says culture secretary Oliver Dowden.
